name: Earl Grey Tea Cookies
author: Nomo-Witch
summary: Earl Grey tea is one of the best teas to use in this recipe, but you can use any tea you prefer. Enjoy these cookies with any type of tea or milk.
ingredients: ½ cup unsalted butter, melted halfway
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray
Combine flour, white sugar, confectioners' sugar, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl
Cut open tea bags and mix tea leaves evenly into the flour mixture
Add butter, eggs, water, and vanilla extract to the flour mixture
Mix with an electric mixer or rubber spatula until dough comes together
Roll dough into balls and shape into 2-inch cookies on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are light brown, about 12 minutes
Cool cookies for 5 minutes before serving
